description: A Roman roadside settlement at a river crossing, originating in the mid 1st CE and reaching its peak by the mid 2nd CE. It appeared to contract during the late 4th CE. A circular structure near the roadside inside the settlement was identified by aerial photography, but not archaeologically investigated. This circular structure was identified as a possible 'shrine'.
bibliography: Booth, P. M. “Asthall, Oxfordshire: Excavations in a Roman Small Town.” Thames Valley Landscape Monograph 9 (1997).
Cook. “A Roman Site at Asthall (1955).” Oxoniensia 20 (1955): 29–39.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Asthall (Oxfordshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
